meaningMnemonic:
When you have <kanji>two</kanji> <kanji>heavy</kanji> things, you have <vocabulary>double</vocabulary> and <vocabulary>dual</vocabulary> the heavy (compared to one, at least). 

This word is a prefix attached to other words to show that it is "double." 二重 kanji time!
readingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
